manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SCAREDY SQUIRREL GOES CAMPING Read more stories featuring Scaredy Squirrel! A picture book about Scaredy Squirrel going on a quest to avoid camping and exploring the great outdoors!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Adorable! Love this little squirrel!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This book is so adorable! Definitely catches the attention of little kiddos. Was a gift for my little nephew, at first he didn't want us to read it. We continued to read the first chapter and he loved it and wanted us to continue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reading is fundamental
reviews.reviewText: My granddaughters love this series. They enjoy reading and we encourage any book that encourages that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love Scaredy Squirrel!
reviews.reviewText: We started reading these books when my oldest (who is now 18) was 5 and they really helped him with his anxiety and managing the unknown. My littlest (now 8) loves scaredy squirrel and was thrilled to see a new book arrive on her book shelf. As expected Scaredy, gets scared and plays dead and then realizes it wasn’t as bad as he thought.Great book and wonderful series - love, love, love!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Story for Quiry Kids
reviews.reviewText: This little squirrel is packed with children's and adult emotions. Very appropriate for social emotional learning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2022
reviews.reviewText: My 5 yr. old granddaughter loved it! That's all that matters. 😆

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Option for Young Readers
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed discovering the Scaredy Squirrel picture books when I first started working at the library, so I was interested in reading this graphic novel, which moves the character into books for a different age range while still capturing familiar elements of the storytelling style. This book will be a good option for reluctant readers, and for children who are aging into chapter books and have an existing appreciation for the character.The story is simple and not a lot happens, and the book mainly revolves around explaining the main character's anxieties, but children will enjoy the humorous details and cute drawings, and Scaredy Squirrel's fear of germs and struggle with social anxiety will be relatable to many children, especially as society begins to adjust to regular life routines again after the pandemic's disruption. However, nothing about this story is specific to COVID-19. It may meet an especially broad audience right now, but can continue to appeal over future years as a fun book about a memorable character, and a story that will help anxious kids feel understood and also laugh at anxiety a little bit.I will look forward to future installments in this graphic novel series, and it will appeal to kids who have enjoyed series like Narwhal and Jelly, and are looking for other simple, easy-to-read graphic novels with animal characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More scaredy squirrel
reviews.reviewText: Scaredy squirrel is back, this time in a graphic novel series. Scaredy squirrel’s adventures span three chapters and include a vacuum (?), pizza and a new friend. As in the picture book series, he spends the majority of his time in his nut tree thinking about everything that could go wrong.Great illustrations, humor and simple text is engaging and perfect for young beginning readers. My 7 year old son and I read it together and couldn’t help smiling as we read. I plan to share with my students when it releases at the end of May as they are big Scaredy squirrel fans! Thanks NetGalley.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Laugh Yourself Silly!
reviews.reviewText: We are all scared of something. Doesn’t matter if you’re short or tall, kitty cat or little kid. Adults get scared too. But it seems scaredy squirrel is extra scared of everything. He takes a who,e to think things out and might appear to some as a little too slowly. But kids and parents alike will get some good belly laughs reading this book. Great storytime/read out loud book, too!I received an advanced reader copy for free from NetGalley and am voluntarily leaving my review.
